name: Anmut
description:
Anmut is a startup consultancy focussed on creating value for our clients through the smart use of data. 

Our vision is that all organisations become data fit well before artificial intelligence transforms organisations.

Anmut was founded by Herman Heyns, an experienced professional with nearly 30 years experience in Finance, Technology, Data & Analytics and Value Management at EY, KPMG and Accenture and Professor Andy Neely, Pro-Vice Chancellor at the University of Cambridge.

team.name: Guy Davis
team.bioHtml: Worked at @Anmut

jobs.title: Analyst
jobs.description:
The role:
•	We are looking for an analyst to join the team. The role will involve high exposure on client projects and day-to-day engagement with the founder. 
•	Your initial focus will be to build your knowledge of Anmut, our products, clients, operations and our market. 
•	It will them centre around becoming a leading problem solver within Anmut. You will be taking complex data-centric challenges and developing innovative, analytically rigorous solutions that we can take to our clients or use to scale our business. 
•	There will be a strong focus on “getting things done” to bring Anmut’s vision to life.
•	There will be an opportunity to shape your role as the business grows. Career paths will naturally evolve either towards a consulting role, or a data scientist role. 

Requirements
•	You are ambitious and want to work at and shape a high growth start-up.
•	Minimum 2:1 Undergraduate degree from top university.
•	Creative problem solver with the drive and discipline to complete tasks quickly and effectively.
•	Ability to communicate well and discuss complex topics with both technical and business audiences.
•	Ability to demonstrate good commercial awareness.
•	Undergraduate degree with extensive modules on data and analytics preferred.
•	Passionate about tackling difficult questions, helping develop strategies to ensure our clients success.
•	Knowledge of consulting – having an understanding of consulting is beneficial, however not essential.

Benefits
•	Salary: £25,000 p.a. plus annual bonus. 
•	Bi-annual salary review
•	Opportunity for equity with career development
•	28 days annual leave inclusive of public holiday
•	Monthly development reviews 
•	Training and development budget for professional development
•	Social events
•	Cycle and run friendly central London office.

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.description:
The role:
•	We are looking for a Data Scientist to join the team. The role centres on developing innovative data science solutions to support our product development and client delivery. 
•	You will be responsible for researching, designing and building data science solutions to support our product development and client delivery.
•	You will be responsible for developing and improving the data science processes at Anmut, in particular around building, deploying and monitoring.
•	You will be required to effectively prioritise and deliver across multiple projects simultaneously.
•	Career development will involve building and leading a data science team.

Requirements
•	You are ambitious and want to work at and shape a high growth start-up.
•	Minimum 2:1 Undergraduate degree from top university in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or equivalent field.
•	Experience with Python or R compulsory.
•	Experience with big data tools (Hadoop, Spark, MongoDB) looked upon favourably.
•	Creative problem solver with the drive and discipline to complete tasks quickly and effectively.
•	Passionate about implementing data science, in particular machine learning, in a corporate setting. 
•	Willingness to keep up to date with the latest advanced statistics and their potential business use cases.

Benefits
•	Salary: £27,500 - £35,000 p.a. (dependent on experience) plus annual bonus. Bi-annual salary reviews.
•	Opportunity for equity with career development.
•	28 days annual leave inclusive of public holiday.
•	Monthly development reviews.
•	Training and development budget for professional development.
•	Social events.
•	Cycle and run friendly central London office.
